Article Title: Women's T20 World Cup: Sophie Ecclestone shines as England crush South Africa by 7 wickets
Article Text:
England vs South Africa (AP Photo)

Brief Scores

SHARJAH: England put up an all-round show to outplay South Africa by seven wickets for their second successive win in the Women's T20 World Cup here on Monday. England's four-pronged spin attack led by Sophie Ecclestone (2/15) strangulated South Africa in the death overs to restrict them to 124/6 after they opted to bat on a tricky wicket.In reply, England lost two wickets inside nine overs, but thereafter opener Danni Wyatt-Hodge (43 off 43) and Nat Sciver-Brunt (48 not out from 36b; 6x4) took complete control of the chase, romping home with four balls to spare.The duo put together a match-winning 64-run partnership that came off just 55 balls.Danni got stumped against the run of play.But by then the equation had boiled down to 11 from 12 balls, and Sciver-Brunt sealed it in the final over smashing Ayabonga Khaka for a boundary through extra cover.Following a sedate start, South Africa lost four wickets in the last four overs and managed just 39 runs.South African skipper Laura Wolvaardt looked resolute but it was Ecclestone who triggered the collapse dismissing the skipper eight runs short of her fifty.Legspinner Sarah Glenn brilliantly complemented Ecclestone, conceding just 1/18 from her four overs.South Africa 124/6; 20 overs (Laura Wolvaardt 42, Annerie Dercksen 20 not out; Sophie Ecclestone 2/15, Sarah Glenn 1/18) lost to England 125/3; 19.2 overs (Danni Wyatt-Hodge 43, Nat Sciver-Brunt 48 not out) by seven wickets.
Article Summary: England beat South Africa by seven wickets in Women's T20 World Cup. Sophie Ecclestone took 2/15 as South Africa were restricted to 124/6. Danni Wyatt-Hodge (43 off 43) and Nat Sciver-Brunt (48 not out from 36b; 6x4) took complete control of the chase.

Article Title: 'Freedom and confidence led to success': Rahane on Mumbai's Irani Cup win as team awarded Rs 1 crore
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Veteran Indian batter Ajinkya Rahane underscored the significance of granting players 'freedom' and 'confidence.' This comes as the Mumbai team was awarded Rs 1 crore by the Mumbai Cricket Association for their remarkable Irani Cup victory.Rahane led Mumbai to end a 27-year drought in the tournament, securing a win against the Rest of India team based on the first-innings lead last week in Lucknow.In addition to the BCCI 's prize of Rs 50 lakh, the MCA announced an additional Rs 1 crore at a felicitation ceremony on Monday, as revealed by MCA secretary Abhay Hadap."There is no secret to success. I am a firm believer of the thought that this game is not for individuals, there are 11 players playing and 4-5 are sitting outside. All the players are equally important," Rahane said when discussing his leadership for both Mumbai and India."As a captain, it is important to give them freedom and confidence because every player in their own capacity is a match-winner. Every player has a responsibility. Those sitting outside can give such inputs which as a captain on the field might not think of," he added.India and Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan credited his unbeaten 222 runs to a promise he made to his younger brother Musheer, who had endured a road accident before the game. Musheer attended the ceremony with a neck support."I have learnt a lot at that level," Sarfaraz said, referring to his brief experience in Test cricket earlier this year."I told him that if I cross fifty, I will make a 200 in which one hundred will be for you," he said. Shreyas Iyer , who scored an essential 57 runs in the first innings, highlighted the importance of team camaraderie."Every tournament (in which) we go forward, we look to create that sort of camaraderie and that relationship in the dressing room and the bond which we create is the result of all these trophies," he said.
Article Summary: Mumbai team awarded Rs 1 crore by the Mumbai Cricket Association for their remarkable Irani Cup victory. Veteran Indian batter Ajinkya Rahane underscored the significance of granting players 'freedom' and 'confidence' Sarfaraz Khan credited his unbeaten 222 runs to a promise he made to his younger brother Musheer.

Article Title: Watch: Coach turns fielder as JP Duminy saves runs for South Africa against Ireland
Article Text:
JP Duminy (Screengrabs)

NEW DELHI: South Africa's batting coach JP Duminy made an unexpected return to the field during the third and final ODI against Ireland in Abu Dhabi on Monday.Known for his distinguished international career before retiring from all formats of cricket in July 2019, Duminy was called upon to fill in as a substitute fielder due to fatigue and heat exhaustion affecting some of South Africa's players.The intense desert heat left several of the team's regular fielders struggling, prompting the team to look for immediate reinforcements.While it's unusual for a coach to step onto the field in an active game, Duminy’s experience and fitness made him an ideal candidate to temporarily fill the gap.Watch:His presence on the field added an interesting piece to the game, showing his willingness to step up for his team even in a non-playing capacity.Having lost their previous two games, Ireland, meanwhile, put up a strong fight in their final ODI of the series, with Paul Stirling leading the charge by smashing 88 runs.His partnership with captain Andy Balbirnie (45) helped Ireland to a much-improved total of 284/9, their highest of the series. Harry Tector also contributed a valuable 60, while Curtis Campher's quickfire 34 off 36 balls provided a boost in the middle order.Despite Ireland’s improved batting display, South Africa’s bowlers, especially Lizaad Williams, made crucial breakthroughs.Williams was the pick of the bowlers, taking four wickets for 56 runs in his 10 overs.Ottneil Baartman and Andile Phehlukwayo supported well, with two wickets each, ensuring South Africa remained competitive in the match.Duminy’s impromptu stint as a fielder, however, was the highlight as his enduring connection with the game and the lengths to which the team was willing to go to adapt to challenging conditions were on full display.
Article Summary: South Africa's batting coach JP Duminy made an unexpected return to the field during the third and final ODI against Ireland in Abu Dhabi on Monday. Duminy was called upon to fill in as a substitute fielder due to fatigue and heat exhaustion affecting some of South Africa's players.

Article Title: India set to participate in Hong Kong Sixes as the tournament returns after seven-year hiatus
Article Text:
Team India (PTI Photo)

Each match consists of five six-ball overs per side, with all players except the wicket-keeper required to bowl one over.



The batter must retire not out upon reaching 31 runs but can return to bat once lower-order players have finished their innings.



If five wickets fall before the completion of five overs, the last remaining batsman continues to bat while the fifth batsman acts as a runner, always taking strike until the sixth wicket falls, ending the innings.



This rule encourages aggressive batting and plenty of sixes, which is the hallmark of the tournament.



Wides and no-balls count as two runs.



Two points are awarded for match victories, making every game in the round-robin stage critical for progression.

NEW DELHI: The Hong Kong Sixes is set to return in 2024 after a seven-year hiatus, and cricket fans around the world are eagerly awaiting the comeback of the fast-paced tournament.The exciting news that India will participate in this year's edition has added to the anticipation.Team India will take part in the 20th edition of the Hong Kong Sixes, which will be held from November 1 to 3 at the Tin Kwong Road Recreation Ground in Hong Kong.Cricket Hong Kong recently confirmed India’s participation through a social media post, stating, "Team India is gearing up to smash it out of the park at HK6! Prepare for explosive power hitting and a storm of sixes that will electrify the crowd!"In previous editions, cricket legends like Sachin Tendulkar and MS Dhoni have represented India in this unique format.The Hong Kong Sixes is renowned for its high-energy format, featuring six-a-side teams and five-over-per-side matches (with eight-ball overs in the final).This fast-paced nature ensures non-stop action, where batsmen aim to hit as many sixes as possible while bowlers try to limit the runs in an ultra-condensed time frame.The smaller teams and shorter overs make every ball crucial.Over the years, the tournament has attracted several international stars, such as Brian Lara Shane Warne , and Wasim Akram , who have added to the prestige of the competition.With the return of this tournament, 12 teams, including powerhouses like India and Pakistan, will compete in the 2024 edition.Pakistan have already announced its squad, led by Faheem Ashraf , and with senior players like Asif Ali and Hussain Talat in the mix, their team is set to be formidable.Historically, South Africa, England, and Pakistan have been the most successful teams in the tournament, each winning five titles, making the 2024 competition even more intense.In terms of rules, the Hong Kong Sixes follows the Laws of Cricket with a few unique twists.India’s participation in the 2024 edition marks the nation's return to the tournament after a long break. Fans will be eager to see how Team India, known for its rich cricketing history, performs in this dynamic format.
Article Summary: Team India will take part in the 20th edition of the Hong Kong Sixes. The tournament will be held from November 1 to 3 at the Tin Kwong Road Recreation Ground in Hong Kong. 12 teams, including powerhouses like India and Pakistan, will compete in the 2024 edition.

Article Title: 24 state teams to compete in fourth National Physical Disability Cricket T20 Championship
Article Text: JAIPUR: The fourth National Physical Disability T20 Cricket Championship 2024 will be held in Udaipur from October 15 to 25.The eleven-day tournament will be organized under the aegis of Differently Abled Cricket Council of India ( DCCI ) and Narayan Seva Sansthan (NSS), which has been engaged in the field of disability for 40 years and has conducted national competitions for disabled talents five times.Around 400 disabled cricketers and more than 100 sports officials from 24 states will participate in the tourney in which 67 matches will be played on 5 grounds.The championship poster was released at the Rajasthan Cricket Academy here on Monday by DCCI general secretary Ravi Chauhan, Maharaj Pratap Singh Chauhan, chairman Khatushyam Ji committee and chief patron of PD and wheelchair cricket, RDCA president Jyotsna Chaudhary and Narayan Seva Santhana officials, public relations chief Bhagwan Prasad Gaur, and media in-charge Vishnu Sharma Hiteshi.24 teams including Rajasthan, Kerala, Delhi, Maharashtra, Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, Punjab, Jammu Kashmir, Baroda, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat, Mumbai, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Chandigarh, West Bengal, Vidarbha, Tamil Nadu, and Bihar will participate in the meet.On this occasion, DCCI general secretary Ravi Chauhan said that no number of congratulations would be enough for Narayan Seva Sansthan president Prashant Agarwal and chairman founder Kailash Ji ‘Manav’ Padma Shri.He further shared that players of respective state teams have been selected based on their performance in various tournaments held last year. All these players are above 18 years of age. Most of the players in this championship suffer from one hand or one leg or have congenital physical disability. Some players also have semi-developed bodies. In fact, DCCI and Narayan Seva Sansthan are playing an important role in giving a platform to the disabled and giving them a life full of rights.The inauguration and closing ceremony will be held in the Field Club, Udaipur.The rolling trophy will be given to the winning team in the closing ceremony. Matches will be played in Udaipur’s Field Club, BN University ground, Geetanjali ground, Narayan Para Sports Academy, Dabok, and Karanpur cricket ground.The participating 24 teams have been divided into four groups and there will be 8 matches every day. From 15 to 22 October, 60 league matches of all four groups will be held. On October 24, the semi-finals will be played between the winner of Group A and Group D and the winner of Group B and Group C. The final will be played at the Field Club on October 25.Narayan Seva Sansthan’s PR head, Bhagwan Prasad Gaur, said that they have started playing a leading role in the field of disabled sports since 2017. The institute has successfully organised two National Para Swimming Championships , National Blind Cricket Championship, National Wheelchair Cricket Championship, and National Disabled Cricket Championship.The organization of the Wheelchair Cricket Championship has been recorded in the Guinness Book of World Records. Standing cricket means some players are disabled with one hand and some with one leg. They will win the hearts of the audience by demonstrating their game like normal cricketers. The institute is committed to providing complete rehabilitation to the disabled by providing them surgery, artificial limbs, self-employment, and mass marriage. More than 11 lakh disabled people have benefited from the institute in some way or another. This championship is also another step in this direction.Vishnu Sharma Hiteshi, Public Relations Officer of the institute, said that in this competition, the institute is supporting food, accommodation, medical, transport, and ground arrangements in Udaipur. This competition will be telecasted live on FanCode.As many as 20 committees have been formed by the institute for the success of the 11-day cricket championship which includes committees for welcome, security, traffic, cleanliness, food, accommodation, practice, timetable, ground, discipline, medical, water, etc.There is a provision of giving 4 runners to each team in standing cricket. These are provided to those players who are unable to run with crutches, artificial limbs, or are physically unable to run. Running between wickets is necessary in cricket. Therefore, each team will select from the options of four disabled runners and will submit the list to the umpire before the start of the match.In this championship, organised with the aim of promoting disabled talents, the cricketer who performs the best will be selected for 'Man of the Series' by the management on the recommendation of the evaluation committee. He will be given a two-wheeler scooty as a prize. 'Man of the Match' awards will be given daily on every ground. Apart from this, prizes will also be given to the winners and runner-up teams.England World Cup champion players are also also participating including India team captain Virat Kenny, Mumbai's Ravindra Sante, Vidarbha's Gurudas Raut, Bengal's Tushar Roy, Gujarat's Asit Jaiswal, Jammu and Kashmir's Wasim Iqbal, and Aamir.
Article Summary: Fourth National Physical Disability T20 Cricket Championship 2024 will be held in Udaipur from October 15 to 25. The eleven-day tournament will be organized under the aegis of Differently Abled Cricket Council of India ( DCCI ) and Narayan Seva Sansthan (NSS), which has been engaged in the field of disability for 40 years.

Article Title: 'It's not an easy game': Abdullah Shafique after smashing ton in Pakistan vs England first Test
Article Text:
Abdullah Shafique (AP Photo)

MULTAN: Pakistan opener Abdullah Shafique is happy to contribute to the team's total after smashing his fifth Test century in the first Test against England in Multan on Monday. He termed it as a 'next level feeling' after ending his century drought in 2024.Pakistan captain Shan Masood won the toss and opted to bat first on the flat pitch and the decision paid well for the team.Apart from Shafique, Masood also reached the three-figure mark with his solid 151-run knock including 13 fours and two sixes. Pakistan are in a solid position with a total of 328/4 at stumps on the opening day of the match.Despite losing Saim Ayub for only four runs in the fourth over, Shafique and Masood stitched a massive 253-run partnership for the second wicket. Shafique was dismissed by Gus Atkinson for 102 post Tea. His innings included 10 fours and two sixes."Feeling happy because performing for the team is a next level feeling. It happens (his low scores in three consecutive Tests). It's not an easy game. I was focusing on the process. When a senior batter like Shan Masood is playing with you, it's a learning moment for me as well," Shafique said after the end of play in Multan."It's hard here in Multan. We have done 4-5 days camp here. Cramps is part of the game, it happens. We are good now," he added.Meanwhile, former captain Babar Azam 's horrid run in the red-ball format continues after Chris Woakes trapped him lbw for 30. The former No. 2 Test batter hasn't hit a single fifty in the last 17 innings he had played since the start of 2023. His last Test century was against New Zealand in Karachi in December 2022.England will look to remove nightwatchman Naseem Shah, who is yet to open his account, and Saud Shakeel (35 not out) early on Day 2. England will have an advantage of the new ball which is less than five overs old.
Article Summary: Abdullah Shafique scores his fifth Test century in first Test against England. Pakistan captain Shan Masood also reached three-figure mark with 151-run knock. Pakistan are in a solid position with a total of 328/4 at stumps on the opening day of the match.

Article Title: 'Real Tuk Tuk at Multan': Babar Azam trolled after another flop show
Article Text:
Babar Azam (AP Photos)

NEW DELHI: Babar Azam 's struggles in Test cricket continued as the former Pakistan captain once again found himself in the spotlight for all the wrong reasons during the first Test against England in Multan on Monday.Despite Pakistan’s strong showing on Day 1, with Shan Masood (151) and Abdullah Shafique (102) putting up a mammoth 253-run stand, Babar failed to capitalize on a golden opportunity to silence his critics.Coming in at a comfortable position, Babar scored 30 off 71 balls, before being trapped lbw by England's Chris Woakes in the final session of the day.Woakes set him up brilliantly, beating him on both the outside and inside edges before delivering a full-length ball that nipped in just enough to hit Babar in front of the stumps.Babar reviewed the decision, hoping for a reprieve, but ball-tracking showed it was crashing into leg stump. The dismissal extended his poor run in Test cricket, leaving fans disappointed once again.What added salt to the wound was the reaction of fans in the stadium.Several spectators were caught on camera sleeping during Babar’s innings, a moment that quickly went viral on social media.Fans expressed their frustration online, trolling the Pakistan skipper for his continued lacklustre performances.Despite Babar forging a 61-run partnership with Saud Shakeel , his inability to convert starts into big scores is becoming a pattern that has fueled criticism, especially given Pakistan's dominance earlier in the day.Pakistan still ended Day 1 in a commanding position at 328/4, thanks to Masood and Shafique’s heroics. But with every failure, the pressure mounts on Babar to regain his form and silence the growing voices of doubt.
Article Summary: Babar Azam dismissed by Chris Woakes in the final session of the day. Pakistan ended Day 1 in a commanding position at 328/4. Shan Masood (151) and Abdullah Shafique (102) put up a mammoth 253-run stand.

Article Title: Arundhati Reddy reprimanded for giving fiery send off to Pakistan's Nida Dar
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India pace bowler Arundhati Reddy has been reprimanded for giving a fiery send-off to Pakistan's Nida Dar , breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct , during the Women’s T20 World Cup Group A match in Dubai on Sunday."Reddy was found to have breached Article 2.5 of the ICC Code of Conduct for Players and Player Support Personnel, which relates to “using language, actions or gestures which disparage or which could provoke an aggressive reaction from a batter upon his/her dismissal during an International Match,” an ICC release stated.In addition to the reprimand, one demerit point has been added to Arundhati Reddy’s disciplinary record, marking her first offence in a 24-month period.The incident took place in the 20th over of Pakistan’s innings when, after dismissing all-rounder Dar, Reddy gestured towards the pavilion.Reddy admitted the offence and accepted the sanction proposed by Shandre Fritz of the Emirates ICC International Panel of Match Referees, negating the need for a formal hearing.The charge was levelled by on-field umpires Eloise Sheridan and Lauren Agenbag , along with third umpire Jacquline Williams and fourth umpire Claire Polosak.Level 1 breaches carry a minimum penalty of an official reprimand, a maximum penalty of 50 per cent of a player’s match fee, and one or two demerit points.
Article Summary: India bowler Arundhati Reddy reprimanded for fiery send-off to Pakistan's Nida Dar. Reddy breached Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the Women’s T20 World Cup Group A match in Dubai.

Despite this rough beginning, Messi went on to have an illustrious career, winning numerous accolades including Copa America and World Cup titles.

Article Title: Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens dies aged 73
Article Text:
Johan Neeskens. (Pic Credit - X)

Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens , considered one of the best midfielders of his generation, has died at the age of 73, the Royal Dutch Football Association ( KNVB ) confirmed on Monday.Neeskens fell ill while working with the KNVB's World Coaches project, for which he was an ambassador, in Algeria. The cause of death has not yet been revealed."The world not only says goodbye to a gifted sportsman but above all, to a compassionate, driven and wonderful person," the KNVB said.Neeskens was part of the Dutch sides that lost the 1974 and 1978 World Cup finals and in 2004 was named one of the 125 Greatest Living Footballers by FIFA . He won 49 caps for his country.A former box-to-box midfielder who was renowned for his stamina, grit and skill, Neeskens spent the majority of his playing career at Ajax Amsterdam , where he won the European Cup three seasons in a row between 1971-73, and at Barcelona , at both clubs alongside compatriot Johan Cruyff.After retirement he was an assistant coach for the Dutch national team at the 1998 World Cup as they finished fourth, and later worked under Frank Rijkaard at Barcelona.He also had a spell as head coach at South African club Mamelodi Sundowns, which was his final role in professional football and ended in 2012.
Article Summary: Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens has died at the age of 73. He was part of the Dutch sides that lost the 1974 and 1978 World Cup finals. In 2004 he was named one of the 125 Greatest Living Footballers by FIFA. The cause of death has not yet been revealed.

Article Title: Need those derbies & fan following, says Bhaichung Bhutia
Article Text:
(PTI Photo)

KOLKATA: Beginning its journey with eight teams 11 summers ago, Indian Super League (ISL) has gradually expanded to 13 teams over these seasons.After being left out of the country's new top-tier ahead of the erstwhile premier division I-League, Kolkata giants Mohun Bagan and East Bengal were included into ISL at the start of the 2019-20 season. Then, honouring the AFC-AIFF envisaged future roadmap for Indian football, I-League champions Punjab FC were promoted to ISL last season.Keeping up with the promise, Kolkata giants Mohammedan Sporting Club - as the current I-League winners - were also added to the lot before the start of the ongoing 2024-25 season. However, despite being the country's highest level of competitive football, ISL is yet to achieve the desired level of fan following among the supporters of the participating clubs.However, Bhaichung Bhutia , the former India captain and one of the few legends to play the game in the country, believes that Mohammedan SC 's presence will add to the intensity of the Kolkata derbies , which in turn will make Indian football more exciting for the fans. The Sikkimese Sniper – as Bhutia was famously known in his playing days, also hopes that the huge fan-bases that come along with the teams like MSC will result in a wider popularity of ISL."It's great for teams with a huge fan base such as Mohammedan SC to come into the ISL. I have always advocated for Mohun Bagan, East Bengal, and Mohammedan SC for coming into the ISL, because these are the teams that have huge passionate fans across India. To make the ISL competitive and interesting, you need those derbies and passionate fans to be there," Bhutia said in an exclusive interview shared with TOI.With talismanic India skipper and striker Sunil Chhetri hanging up his boots four months ago, Bhutia had a straightforward message for the youngsters who are shouldering the responsibilities of the Indian team under the stewardship of new head coach Manolo Marquez."You need to be consistent with the national team. You need to start delivering, and it's teamwork. Obviously, you will have great coaches, but as a player there should be consistency in performances, and you need to keep working hard," Bhutia added.Asked to pick his favourite teams for the season, Bhutia said, "It's difficult to predict the favourites for the title. Mohun Bagan (Super Giant) have put in a lot of budget to make a great team. Mumbai City FC, who didn't have a great Durand Cup, are a team that will always have a good side. FC Goa have been consistent throughout the years. I think these are the few teams that are going to be favourites for this season."Over the years, ISL has moved on from its novelty factor as global stars - well past their prime - have stopped coming to India to join a developing league for a season or two. But Bhutia personally still loves to go down the lane when asked about his memorable moments from the league."My best memory of the ISL will always be the first year, with some of the greatest footballers around the world coming and playing for us. In the first season, you had players like (Alessandro) Del Piero, Nicolas Anelka, Robert Pires, and a lot of big stars playing with our own local players!" he said before signing off.
Article Summary: Bhaichung Bhutia believes Mohammedan SC will add to the intensity of the Kolkata derbies. The Sikkimese Sniper also hopes that the huge fan-bases that come along with the teams like MSC will result in a wider popularity of ISL. The former India captain also has a straightforward message for the youngsters.

Article Title: Rajasthan women crash to 5-0 defeat
Article Text: JAIPUR: It was an embarrassing start for hosts Rajasthan as they were outplayed by Chhattisgarh 5-0 in a Group E match of the 29th Senior Women's National Football Championship for Rajmata Jijabai Trophy 2024-25 at the Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium here on Sunday. Priyanka Futan was the star performer for the winners with three goals. Hina Nirmalkar scored the other two goals for the winners.Rajasthan kept Chhattisgarh on the same score till the end of the first half, but Chhattisgarh came back stronger to score four goals in the second half.Nirmalkar scored two goals in the 49th and 55th minutes to increase the lead to 3-0. Futan scored two more goals in the 70th and then in the 81st minute to help Chhattisgarh seal a comprehensive victory.In the first match of the day, Punjab defeated Uttarakhand 3-1 to secure three points. Courtesy Lalam Haokip, Punjab took the lead in the 14th minute itself. In the 53rd minute, Mitali Melwal opened the account for Uttarakhand and levelled the scoreline. Punjab was gifted a goal when Uttarakhand's Achala Puri scored an own goal in the 69th minute while Nisha struck in the 73rd minute.Earlier, deputy chief minister Diya Kumari , who was also the chief guest, inaugurated the newly-constructed astro turf football ground at Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium. "The stadium will be developed into a world-class facility. It features a FIFA-approved football field," she said.Youth affairs and sports secretary and Rajasthan State Sports Council chairman Neeraj K Pawan, Rajasthan Football Association secretary Dilip Singh Shekhawat, Rajasthan United Football Club president KK Tank and the association's Women's Wing chairperson Roshni Tank were also present on this occasion.
Article Summary: Priyanka Futan was the star performer for the winners with three goals. Punjab defeated Uttarakhand 3-1 to secure three points. Deputy chief minister Diya Kumari inaugurated the newly-constructed astro turf football ground at Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium.

Article Title: Manchester United stalemate keeps Erik ten Hag in danger, Spurs rocked by Brighton
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Erik ten Hag maintains he has the support of Manchester United 's management despite a 0-0 draw against Aston Villa on Sunday, adding to a difficult season start.The draw leaves United in 14th place in the Premier League with just two wins from seven games.Bruno Fernandes hit the bar with a second-half free kick, while Diogo Dalot's block prevented Villa's Jaden Philogene from scoring.Ten Hag's side has not won in five consecutive games across all competitions.United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe, who attended the match, did not confirm Ten Hag's job security earlier. However, Ten Hag remains optimistic. He stated, "We always speak, we speak every week. We are all onboard together, on one page."In another match, Tottenham Hotspur squandered a 2-0 lead to lose 3-2 at Brighton. Goals from Brennan Johnson and James Maddison initially put Tottenham ahead, but Brighton responded with goals from Yankuba Minteh, Georginio Rutter, and Danny Welbeck. This result is Tottenham's third defeat in seven league games.Earlier, Chelsea drew 1-1 with 10-man Nottingham Forest. Chris Wood scored for Forest, while Noni Madueke equalized for Chelsea. Despite Forest's James Ward-Prowse receiving a red card, Chelsea could not secure a win.This result leaves Chelsea in fourth place in the league going into the international break.
Article Summary: Erik ten Hag maintains he has the support of Manchester United's management. Ten Hag's side has not won in five consecutive games across all competitions. Tottenham Hotspur squandered a 2-0 lead to lose 3-2 at Brighton. Chelsea drew 1-1 with 10-man Nottingham Forest.
